Mass. pension board to give bonuses up to 40 percent

Despite the fact that the fund lost value through the fiscal year, the state pension agency is set to give a huge $815,000 performance bonus package to its staff. (Globe)

Mass. alone in sending registrations

The state is the only one that agreed to send mass mailings to register welfare recipients to vote, following lawsuits brought by the liberal group Demos, which is chaired by Elizabeth Warren's daughter. (Boston Globe)
  • 8/9 Welfare flap shows differing approaches in race
  • 8/8 Brown: Efforts to register geared to boost Warren
  • Editorial: Mass. justified in mailings to aid recipients

GOP assails battery maker's China deal

A Chinese company's agreement to invest in Waltham's A123 Systems Inc. has ignited criticisms by Republicans that the Obama administration squandered billions in stimulus money with risky investments. (Boston Globe)
  • Press release A123 announces Wanxiang deal

Strolling through the ruins of street art with Os Gemeos

Brazilian street artists Os Gemeos bring a spritely, one-room show to the ICA, which is complemented by three vivid murals around the city. (Boston Globe)

News

NASA's 'green' planetary
test lander crashes, burns

Earlier this week NASA safely landed a robotic rover on Mars about 150 million miles away. But on Thursday here on Earth, a test model planetary lander crashed and burned at Kennedy Space Center just seconds after liftoff.
